content: Singaporean politician (born 1989) **Lee Hui Ying**[a] (born 5 May 1989) is a Singaporean politician. A member of the [People's Action Party](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party), she has been a [Member of Parliament](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore) for the [Nee Soon Group Representation Constituency](/wiki/Nee_Soon_Group_Representation_Constituency) since (/wiki/2025_Singaporean_general_election). ## Career Lee has held positions in the communications role in the [Ministry of Digital Development and Information](/wiki/Ministry_of_Digital_Development_and_Information), [Ministry of Transport](/wiki/Ministry_of_Transport_(Singapore)) and [Ministry of Health](/wiki/Ministry_of_Health_(Singapore)). She is presently the Director of Communications at [Temasek Foundation](/wiki/Temasek_Foundation), a non-profit organisation that supports diverse impactful programmes to uplift communities. ## Personal life Lee is single, and is a middle child with 2 sisters. ## Notes [Parliament of Singapore](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore)Preceded by[K. Shanmugam](/wiki/K._Shanmugam) [Derrick Goh](/wiki/Derrick_Goh) [Carrie Tan](/wiki/Carrie_Tan) [Louis Ng](/wiki/Louis_Ng) [Muhammad Faishal Ibrahim](/wiki/Muhammad_Faishal_Ibrahim) **Member of Parliament for [Nee Soon GRC](/wiki/Nee_Soon_Group_Representation_Constituency)** 2025–present Served alongside: **(2025–present): [K. Shanmugam](/wiki/K._Shanmugam), [Syed Harun Alhabsyi](/wiki/Syed_Harun_Alhabsyi), [Goh Hanyan](/wiki/Goh_Hanyan), [Jackson Lam](/wiki/Jackson_Lam)****Incumbent** This article about a politician from Singapore is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
title: Lee Hui Ying
